pageContext.description: This has been varnished. 2 lots of rough metal adhere to septum. Reddish gravel shows nearly all over.
pageContext.patina: Lightish green, with a thin coating of encrustment of a darker shade.
pageContext.associations: One of a Bronze Founder's Hoard of 62 pieces, composed of fragments of the following: 24 socketed celts; 6 swords; 4 spearheads; 2 Knife sockets; 1 sword chape; 1 Tang of sickle; also 15 Lumps of Metal; 7 Fragments of undecisive shapes. 1 socketed gouge, and 1 gouge socket.
pageContext.publications: Trans. Essex Arch. Soc. N.S., vi. 173 and N.S. XVI, p. 266,Sir. C. Fox, Arch Cambriensis, Dec. 1941, p. 144, No. 10, (Pl. II),Proc. Soc. Antiq., 2nd S., XVI, p. 98
pageContext.collection: Colchester Museum,180.96,Purchased by the Colchester Corporation, 1896,(Trans. Essex Arch. Soc., N.S. VI.173)
pageContext.toSearch: Southchurch, Southend-on-sea, Southend-on-sea, Southend-on-sea Ss1, UK
